name: postpositively
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
In grammar, if an adjective, etc. occurs postpositively, it comes after the word it modifies (= whose meaning it limits or adds to). : "Elect", as in "the president elect", is one of a very small number of adjectives that occur postpositively. These adjectives can only be positioned predicatively or postpositively.
More examplesFewer examples"Redux" belongs to a small class of English adjectives that are always used postpositively, that is, they always follow the words they modify.
